narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Ranran Wang  Ranran Wang
Instructor: Ranran Wang  Ranran Wang
Instructor: Ranran Wang  Ranran was very helpful!
Instructor: Ranran Wang  I interacted more with the two instructors than with the Teaching Assistant but found her to be helpful as well.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The biggest advantage of this course is that it offers something that FES is otherwise lacking - a focused discussion on interdisciplinary work and what it means to be interdisciplinary and to conduct interdisciplinary work. For a school that has a stated interdisciplinary focus and a multitude of interdisciplinary students (as well as single-discipline students, as there should be a mix) there is a marked lack of actual directed study and focus on interdisciplinary classes.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Student presentations and peer editing
Group discussions and many of the readings.
The discussions!
Class discussions were incredible.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Readings - I felt that our discussions often focused more on the content of the readings (ie the topic being studied) rather than how and why integration occurred. I would have preferred more readings like those we did at the beginning of the course about frameworks, epistemology, methodology, rather than the format of choosing a different topic every week to discuss.I think the course would work better as a methods course and/or as a course where people conducting ID research could talk with others in different disciplines to gain new perspectives and understanding.Overall I think the course needs a more critical perspective on how ID research is conducted, it's inherent assumptions and methodological/epistemological constraints, and ways to improve our own understanding.
More time is needed to discuss our own research.
Some adjustments could be made to readings and to direct research methods. The instructors were very responsive throughout the term and adjusted readings as the course progressed as well.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: NA
Course lectures were focused on the readings and lead into the class discussions very effectively.

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Ranran Wang  I didn't see the need for a TF for this class other than as someone to upload readings and manage the Classesv2 website.I think the instructors/TF for the course would be more effective if they served as mentors for students as they work through developing research questions and stud design - again this course would work better as a methods course.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This class was a critical course for me to help understand how to merge my research with my policy-oriented future academic and career goals.

I am an interdisciplinary student with a focus that mixes a couple of different, traditionally separate disciplines. Having a chanceto actively read and discuss how to actually do interdisciplinary work is hugely helpful and will be for future students as well.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I am conducting interdisciplinary research and thought it would be helpful to gain new ideas and think more critically about this type of work and its applicability to non-academic settings.
Wanted a research methods course that combined both quantitative and qualitative methods.

I took this course because it is the only interdisciplinary course related to research at FES and it is necessary for me to understand how to be an interdisciplinary researcher in order to be effective in the world and the work I want to do after leaving FES.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes

In many ways the knowledge exceeded my expectations. I thought I knew what interdisciplinary was, but I now have a much deeper, greater understanding of it and how it relates to other areas of research and work.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: na
It was a good opportunity to practice interdisciplinary methods.
Peer edits of research paper.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: The course seems designed more for PhD and MESc students, which is fine but it should be advertised as such or altered to be more applicable to the FES community as a whole. This would best be done by including a TF or joint professor who can speak from a non-academic (ie applied) view of integration and its use in the "real" world, so to speak.
I would highly recommend this course to my peers.

If you are interested at all in interdisciplinary work at FES or beyond, this course is necessary to frame your understanding of interdisciplinarity and to help you become much more effective as an interdisciplinary researcher and/or applied consultant or whatever it is you are working towards.
